original: 'di snyed cig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon sum du lung ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di snyed cig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon sum du lung ma bstan te /
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½

original: de lta na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / nye bar gnas par gyur to zhes de ltar rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / nye bar gnas par gyur to zhes de ltar rig par bgyi'o //
translated: â€œEven though they have not been directly indicated by the TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, as to the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, saying, â€˜You will become a perfect buddha, a tathÄgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, a knowledgeable and venerable one, a sugata, one who knows the world, an unsurpassed guide who tames beings, a teacher to gods and men, as many as this many are, in the future, going to become perfectly awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,â€™ still, those bodhisattva great beings should know that they are close to the indication of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur du yod la mnyan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur du yod la mnyan du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I have seen this deep perfection of wisdom, have bowed down to it, have honored it, and have listened to it.

original: thos nas kyang gzung du yod do //ğŸ”½bcang du yod do //ğŸ”½klag tu yod do //
analyzed: thos nas kyang gzung du yod do // bcang du yod do // klag tu yod do //
translated: Having listened to it, I have taken it up.ğŸ”½I have borne it in mind.ğŸ”½I have recited it.

original: kun chub par byar yod do //
analyzed: kun chub par byar yod do //
translated: I have understood it.

original: tshul bzhin du yid la byar yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bgyi bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la byar yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bgyi bar rig par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: It should be understood that because it is possible to attend properly to it is the preparation for the uninterrupted [path].

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

original: @184a * // dpyid kyi dus la bab ste rtsi shing gi lo ma dang / 'dab ma lhags nas kha dog gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: @184a * // dpyid kyi dus la bab ste rtsi shing gi lo ma dang / 'dab ma lhags nas kha dog gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: when the spring season has arrived and the leaves and petals of the trees and plants have fallen off and changed color,

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyis ring por mi thogs par lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyis ring por mi thogs par lo ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the people of JambudvÄ«pa know that it will not be long before leaves, flowers, and fruits appear.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar snga ltas 'di dag rtsi shing la snang bas da ni 'di nas ring por mi thogs par lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams rtsi shing la snga ltas de dag mthong nas nyams bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar snga ltas 'di dag rtsi shing la snang bas da ni 'di nas ring por mi thogs par lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes 'dzam bu gling pa'i mi rnams rtsi shing la snga ltas de dag mthong nas nyams bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those signs appear on the trees and plants, the people of JambudvÄ«pa, seeing those signs on the trees and plants, become happy, thinking, 'Now it will not be long before leaves, flowers, and fruits appear.'

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di blta ba dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mnyan du mchis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang gang gi tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di blta ba dang / phyag bgyi ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mnyan du mchis te /
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, when a bodhisattva great being has the opportunity to see, pay homage to, serve, and hear this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: thos nas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: thos nas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: and having heard it, to take it up,

original: 'chang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur /
translated: bear it in mind,

original: klog cing kun chub par bgyi ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par 'tshal bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: klog cing kun chub par bgyi ba dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par 'tshal bar bgyi'o //
translated: recite it, master it, and properly pay attention to it, Blessed One, we should know that bodhisattva great being has fully ripened wholesome roots.

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur bar 'tshal bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur bar 'tshal bar bgyi ste /
translated: Blessed One, we should know that those sons of a good family and daughters of a good family have served many buddhas.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des kyang 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab ma 'di blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mnyan du yod pa dang / ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgrub par bya bar yod pa ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bgyi bar 'tshal par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des kyang 'di ltar bdag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab ma 'di blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mnyan du yod pa dang / ji skad du bstan pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgrub par bya bar yod pa ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur to zhes bgyi bar 'tshal par bgyi'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahÄsattva should think, â€˜Through my previous roots of goodness, I have come near to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, since I have seen this deep perfection of wisdom, have bowed down to it, have honored it, have listened to it, and have practiced the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.â€™

original: de nas lha'i bu sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snga ltas de dag mthong nas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lung bstan par gyur pa la snga ltas 'di
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu sngon sangs rgyas mthong ba ji snyed cig mchis pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snga ltas de dag mthong nas sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams lung bstan par gyur pa la snga ltas 'di
translated: â€œThen the devas who have seen buddhas before, having seen those signs of the bodhisattva mahÄsattva, will say to the bodhisattva mahÄsattva, â€˜In the past, when bodhisattva mahÄsattvas were predicted to awakening, these signs appeared.

original: dag byung gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro zhes rab tu dga' zhing spro la yid bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni
analyzed: dag byung gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de yang ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung ston par 'gyur ro zhes rab tu dga' zhing spro la yid bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ni
translated: And that bodhisattva great being who has been purified will quickly receive a prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la nye ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: This is the application to manifest and perfect awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:

analyzed: bud med sbrum ma ni ji lta ji @184b ltar btsar nye bar gyur pa de lta de ltar lus 'gyur zhing lus la sdug bsngal drag pa dang / nyam chung bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: mchi snying mi 'tshal bar 'gyur /

original: dran pa chung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dran pa chung bar 'gyur /

analyzed: kha zas chung du 'tshal bar 'gyur /

translated: â€œBhagavÄn, in the same way, when a woman has a dream in which she sees a man, and she is touched by that thought, that recollection, and that service, she experiences a feeling like that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bud med rnams kyis bud med de'i mtshan ma ji lta ji ltar mthong ba las bud med 'di ni ring por mi thogs par btsa' bar 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bud med rnams kyis bud med de'i mtshan ma ji lta ji ltar mthong ba las bud med 'di ni ring por mi thogs par btsa' bar 'gyur ro zhes bgyi bar 'tshal lo //
translated: â€œBhagavÄn, other women can tell from the signs on the body of that woman that she will give birth before long.â€

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa /
translated: â€œBhagavÄn, in the same way, when the roots of merit of bodhisattva mahÄsattvas have increased,

analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba /
translated: they have served many buddhas,

original: legs pa'i spyod pa spyad pa /
analyzed: legs pa'i spyod pa spyad pa /

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba /

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa rnams la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'thad par gyur te /

analyzed: 'thad par gyur nas kyang 'dzin par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'chang bar 'gyur /

original: klog par 'gyur /
analyzed: klog par 'gyur /
translated: will read it,

original: kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
analyzed: kun chub par bgyid par 'gyur /
translated: will master it,

original: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid par 'gyur na /
translated: and will properly pay attention to it,

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur bar rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ring por mi thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur bar rig par bgyi'o //
translated: then, Blessed One, one should know that those bodhisattva great beings will not be long before they receive a prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

translated: â€œExcellent, ÅšÄriputra, excellent!

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu khyod kyi spobs pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi mthus skyes so zhes bya ba ni myur du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: ÅšÄriputra, your eloquence has arisen through the power of the Buddha.â€ This is the application to quickly attain manifest complete buddhahood.ğŸ”½Then the venerable SubhÅ«ti said to the Blessed One,

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: â€œBlessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag de ltar yongs su bzung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag de ltar yongs su bzung ba ni ngo mtshar che'o //
translated: â€œBlessed One, it is truly amazing that the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas have taken such care of those bodhisattva great beings.â€

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / @185a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni skye bo mang po la phan pa dang / skye bo mang po la bde ba'i phyir dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / @185a * //
translated: â€œSubhÅ«ti, it is because those bodhisattva great beings have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in order to benefit many beings, to bring happiness to many beings, to compassionately care for the world,

original: lha dang / mi'i skye bo'i tshogs phal po che'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te /
analyzed: lha dang / mi'i skye bo'i tshogs phal po che'i don dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te /
translated: and to benefit, help, and bring happiness to a great multitude of beings, including gods and humans.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When they practice the bodhisattva way of life,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa bzhis sems can brgya phrag du ma dang / sems can stong phrag du ma dang / sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pa bzhis sems can brgya phrag du ma dang / sems can stong phrag du ma dang / sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag du ma rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: He will be one who, through the four means of unificationâ€”generosity, kind talk, meaningful actions, and practicing what one preachesâ€”will look after many hundreds of sentient beings, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands, many millions, many tens of millions, many billions, many tens of billions, many trillions, and many quintillions of sentient beings.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par len du 'jug go //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la yang dag par len du 'jug go //
translated: He will be one who will cause many hundreds of sentient beings, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands, many millions, many tens of millions, many billions, many tens of billions, many trillions, and many quintillions of sentient beings to take up the ten virtuous actions.

original: bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhin rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams yang dag par len du 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi rnams dang / tshad med pa bzhin rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams yang dag par len du 'jug go //
translated: He will be one who will cause many hundreds of sentient beings, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands, many millions, many tens of millions, many billions, many tens of billions, many trillions, and many quintillions of sentient beings to take up the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions.

original: bdag nyid kyang chos de rnams la gnas par 'gyur ro //ğŸ”½bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang chos de rnams la gnas par 'gyur ro // bdag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do //
translated: He will be one who will himself abide in those dharmas.ğŸ”½He will be one who himself practices the perfection of generosity.

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'god do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par 'god do //
translated: He will be one who establishes others in the perfection of generosity.

original: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par spyod cing gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'god do //ğŸ”½bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bdag kyang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par spyod cing gzhan yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu 'god do // bdag kyang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: I myself will practice the perfection of morality and I will establish others in the perfection of morality.ğŸ”½I myself will practice the perfection of patience and I will establish others in the perfection of patience.

original: bdag kyang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bdag kyang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: I myself will practice the perfection of perseverance and I will establish others in the perfection of perseverance.

original: bdag kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bdag kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: I myself will practice the perfection of concentration and I will establish others in the perfection of concentration.

original: bdag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: bdag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: I myself will practice the perfection of wisdom and I will establish others in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing thabs mkhas pas sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed do //
translated: They stand in the perfection of wisdom, and through skill in means they establish beings in the fruit of a Streamwinner, but they do not actualize the fruit of a Streamwinner.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid dgra bcom pa'i bar mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid dgra bcom pa'i bar mngon du mi byed do //
translated: Similarly, they establish beings in the fruit of a Once-Returner, of a Never-Returner, and of an Arhat, but they do not actualize the fruit of an Arhat.

original: sems can rnams rang sangs rgyas la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid rang byang chub mngon du mi byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams rang sangs rgyas la rab tu 'god kyang bdag nyid rang byang chub mngon du mi byed do //
translated: They establish beings in the state of a Pratyekabuddha, but they do not actualize the state of a Pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon la /
analyzed: bdag kyang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa gnon la /
translated: They themselves stand on the irreversible stage,

original: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu 'god do //
translated: and they establish others on the irreversible stage.

translated: I myself purify a Buddha-field, and I instigate other Bodhisattvas to purify a Buddha-field.

analyzed: gzhan yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo // bdag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed la /
translated: I myself bring beings to maturity, and I instigate others to bring beings to maturity.

original: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo //ğŸ”½bdag kyang gzungs kyi sgo yongs su sbyong la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par shes pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo // bdag kyang gzungs kyi sgo yongs su sbyong la /
translated: I myself generate the superknowledges of a Bodhisattva, and I instigate others to attain the superknowledges.

original: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo yongs su sbyong ba la yang dag par bskul lo //ğŸ”½bdag kyang spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzungs kyi sgo yongs su sbyong ba la yang dag par bskul lo // bdag kyang spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par byed la /

original: gzhan yang spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par bskul lo //
translated: I myself attain perfect eloquence, and I instigate others to attain perfect eloquence.

original: bdag kyang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin la /
translated: I will also perfect the form of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo //

original: bdag kyang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin la /
analyzed: bdag kyang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su 'dzin la /
translated: I will also perfect the major and minor marks of a Buddha.

original: gzhan yang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtshan phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba la yang dag par bskul lo //

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te gzugs mkhyen to //ğŸ”½gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te gzugs mkhyen to // gzugs ji ltar mkhyen ce na de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang /
translated: â€œMoreover, SubhÅ«ti, the TathÄgata, thanks to this perfection of wisdom, knows form.

original: dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to //
translated: How does he know it? He knows it as suchness, as unaltered suchness, as non-differentiation, as non-distinction, as signless, as without mental activity, as without effort, as unobtainable.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mkhyen to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mkhyen to //
translated: He knows feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ji ltar mkhyen ce na /ğŸ”½de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan @221a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ji ltar mkhyen ce na / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan @221a * //
translated: How does he know them?

original: ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs su med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to //
translated: He knows them as suchness, as unaltered suchness, as non-differentiation, as non-distinction, as signless, as without mental activity, as without effort, as unobtainable.

original: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te /
translated: In this way, SubhÅ«ti, the TathÄgata, relying on this perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can pha rol po rnams dang / gang zag pha rol po rnams kyi sems g-yo ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po rnams dang / gang zag pha rol po rnams kyi sems g-yo ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa rnams kyang de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang /
translated: knows the movement, gathering, spreading, and contraction of the minds of other beings, of other persons, as it is, as suchness, as non-erroneous suchness, as unchanging,

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bad pa med pa dang / spros pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ji lta ba de ltar mkhyen to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: as non-conceptual, as signless, as effortless, as unelaborated, and as baseless. This is the knowledge of suchness.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na g-yo ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na g-yo ba dang / 'du ba dang / bkram pa dang / bcum pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: In this way, SubhÅ«ti, the suchness of movement, gathering, spreading, and contraction is the suchness of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of dependent origination is the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of all phenomena is the suchness of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the six perfections is the suchness of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the thirty-seven factors of awakening is the suchness of all emptinesses.

original: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of all emptinesses is the suchness of the eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyi gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //ğŸ”½tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad rnams dang / mthar gyi gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do // tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the eight liberations and the nine serial absorptions is the suchness of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions.ğŸ”½The suchness of the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless absorptions is the suchness of the four noble truths.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan @221b ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan @221b ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the four noble truths is the suchness of the emptiness gate of liberation, the signlessness gate of liberation, and the wishlessness gate of liberation.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon par shes pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mngon par shes pa drug gi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness gateways to liberation is the suchness of the six higher perceptions.

original: mngon par shes pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug gi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the six higher perceptions is the suchness of all meditative absorptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of all meditative absorptions is the suchness of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways.

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of all dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways is the suchness of the ten powers of the tathÄgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the ten powers of the tathÄgatas is the suchness of the four fearlessnesses.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the four fearlessnesses is the suchness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges is the suchness of great love and great compassion.

original: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of great love and great compassion is the suchness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha is the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is the suchness of wholesome and unwholesome dharmas.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang ;ğŸ”½kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang ; kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of virtuous and nonvirtuous phenomena is the suchness of mundane and supramundane phenomena, of contaminated and uncontaminated phenomena, of reprehensible and irreproachable phenomena,ğŸ”½of afflicted and unafflicted phenomena, of purified phenomena, and of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of conditioned and unconditioned phenomena is the suchness of past, future, and present phenomena.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The thusness of past, future, and present phenomena is the thusness of the stream enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin @222a * //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin @222a * //
translated: The thusness of the stream enterer is the thusness of the result of stream enterer.

original: nyid do // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nyid do // rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The thusness of the result of stream enterer is the thusness of the result of once-returner.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yi pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yi pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The thusness of the result of once-returner is the thusness of the result of non-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The thusness of the result of non-returner is the thusness of the state of arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The thusness of the state of arhat is the thusness of the result of arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of the result of arhatship is the suchness of a pratyekabuddha.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of a pratyekabuddha is the suchness of a pratyekabuddhaâ€™s awakening.

original: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of a pratyekabuddhaâ€™s awakening is the suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is the suchness of a tathÄgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The suchness of a tathÄgata is the suchness of all beings.

original: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, the suchness of a tathÄgata and the suchness of all beings is a single suchness.

original: de ni lhun gyis grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do ;
analyzed: de ni lhun gyis grub pa'i de bzhin nyid do ;
translated: That is the thusness that is spontaneously present.

original: / lhun gyis grub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: / lhun gyis grub pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni mi zad pa'o //
translated: That which is the thusness that is spontaneously present is inexhaustible.

original: mi zad pa de ni mi zad pa nyid kyis gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: mi zad pa de ni mi zad pa nyid kyis gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: That which is inexhaustible is not dual and cannot be made dual, because of the inexhaustibility.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te mngon par shes par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten te mngon par shes par sangs rgyas so //
translated: SubhÅ«ti, the thusness of all dharmas, that the TathÄgata has awakened to by relying on this perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: SubhÅ«ti, therefore this perfection of wisdom gives birth to the tathÄgatas.

original: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'jig rten gyi ston par byed pa'o //
translated: SubhÅ«ti, in that way this perfection of wisdom teaches the world.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud do //
translated: In this way, SubhÅ«ti, the TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One has understood the suchness of all dharmas.

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud de /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid thugs su chud de /
translated: He has understood the unmistaken suchness and the unaltered suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes brjod do //
translated: By means of that suchness, he is called the TathÄgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: @222b rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /ğŸ”½bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @222b rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: SubhÅ«ti said:

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid 'di ni zab ste /
translated: Blessed One, this suchness of all dharmas, this unmistaken suchness and unaltered suchness is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid 'dis ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub bstan to //
translated: Blessed One, by means of this suchness, the enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas is revealed.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dir slar mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par gzhan su zhig mos par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dir slar mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa rnams dang / dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa rnams ma gtogs par gzhan su zhig mos par 'gyur /
translated: Bhagavan, who other than irreversible Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, persons who are perfect in view, and Arhats whose defilements are exhausted, would believe in this?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par sangs rgyas nas gsungs pa'i bar ni shin tu zab bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'di mngon par sangs rgyas nas gsungs pa'i bar ni shin tu zab bo //
translated: Bhagavan, the Tathagata has taught this Dharma after having fully awakened to it, and it is very profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar de bzhin nyid ni mi zad pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, thusness is inexhaustible.

original: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi zad ce na /
translated: Why is it inexhaustible?

original: chos thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi zad pa'i phyir mi zad pa'i de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is inexhaustible thusness because all dharmas are inexhaustible.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gsungs te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gsungs te /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata has taught thusness after having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa de mchog tu yang dag par gsungs shing btags pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa de mchog tu yang dag par gsungs shing btags pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The suchness of all dharmas is the suchness of the perfect Buddha, which is spoken of and designated as supreme.

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lha rdzas kyi tsandan gyi phye ma yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad lha rdzas kyi tsandan gyi phye ma yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Then all the sons of gods in the great billionfold world system, whether in the desire realm or the form realm, took up divine sandalwood powder

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do //

analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'khod nas 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol te /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: â€œDivine princes, the defining characteristic of this profound perfection of wisdom is emptiness.

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i @223a * //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba med pa'o //

analyzed: mtshan nyid 'gag pa med pa'o //

translated: Its characteristic is the absence of purification.ğŸ”½Its characteristic is the absence of substance.

analyzed: mtshan nyid rang bzhin med pa'i mtshan nyid rten pa med pa'o //
translated: Its characteristic is the absence of intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid nam mkha'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid nam mkha'o //
translated: Its characteristic is space.

original: mtshan nyid rtag pa med pa'o //ğŸ”½mtshan nyid chad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rtag pa med pa'o // mtshan nyid chad pa med pa'o //
translated: Its characteristic is the absence of permanence.ğŸ”½Its characteristic is the absence of annihilation.

analyzed: mtshan nyid don gcig pa ma yin pa'o // mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Its characteristic is the absence of singularity.ğŸ”½Its characteristic is the absence of multiplicity.

original: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar tha snyad du mdzad de /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di'i mtshan nyid de lta bu yin yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar tha snyad du mdzad de /
translated: â€œGods, although the characteristic of this profound perfection of wisdom is like that, the TathÄgata has designated it conventionally as a worldly convention,

analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa shes pa yin no //
translated: not ultimately.â€ This is the knowledge of non-arising and non-cessation, and so on.

analyzed: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis dkrugs par nus pa med do //
translated: â€œDivine princes, those characteristics cannot be disturbed by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Because the world with its gods, humans, and asuras is itself those characteristics. Divine princes, that which cannot be disturbed by characteristics does not cause the knowledge of the characteristics of the absence of characteristics.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid yod pa dang ; mtshan nyid med pa de gnyis ka la yang gang gis shes par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid yod pa dang ; mtshan nyid med pa de gnyis ka la yang gang gis shes par bya ba'am /
translated: Thus, in both the presence and absence of characteristics, it is impossible to know either that by which one knows or that which is known.

analyzed: gang shes par bya ba mi srid do zhes bya ba ni chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa med pa shes pa yin no //

translated: â€œDivine princes, those characteristics are not conditioned by form.

analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no // khams kyis 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi @223b pha rol tu phyin pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no // bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not conditioned by the perfection of morality.ğŸ”½It is not conditioned by the perfection of patience.

analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams kyis 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

original: tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgus 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pas 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyis 'dus byas pa ma yin no //

analyzed: lha'i bu dag gal te la la zhig nam mkha'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes zer na /

translated: would that person be speaking correctly?â€ğŸ”½The gods said,

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

translated: Why is that?ğŸ”½Blessed One, since the space element is unconditioned, space has no characteristics whatsoever.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nam mkha'i khams 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du nam mkha' la mtshan nyid cung zad kyang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nam mkha'i khams 'dus ma bgyis pa'i slad du nam mkha' la mtshan nyid cung zad kyang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa shes pa'o //
translated: This is the knowledge of non-conceptuality.

original: @224a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: @224a * // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /ğŸ”½de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: â€œDivine princes, whether the TathÄgatas arise or not,

original: chos kyi dbyings 'di gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings 'di gnas pa nyid de /
translated: this dharmadhÄtu remains.

original: de ltar mtshan nyid gnas pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan nyid gnas pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: In that way, the TathÄgata has fully awakened to the reality of the abiding of those characteristics just as it is.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the TathÄgata is called the TathÄgata.

original: lha'i bu dag gis gsol pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gis gsol pa /
translated: The divine princes said:ğŸ”½â€œBlessed One, the TathÄgata has fully awakened to the reality of the abiding of those characteristics just as it is.

original: bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mtshan nyid zab mo 'di de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The Blessed One, the Thus-Gone One, has fully awakened to this profound characteristic.

original: mtshan nyid gang rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang rnams mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i slad du de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa mi mnga' ba'i ye shes can no //
translated: Because of having fully awakened to these characteristics, the Thus-Gone One possesses unattached wisdom.

original: mtshan nyid gang dag la bzhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang dag la bzhugs nas de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
translated: Abiding in these characteristics, the Thus-Gone One has perfectly revealed all characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pas /
translated: Blessed One, by perfectly revealing the perfection of wisdom,

original: mtshan nyid de dag yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag yang dag par rab tu bstan to //
translated: these characteristics are perfectly revealed.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa de tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa de tsam du de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul du 'gyur te /
translated: Blessed One, to the extent that the perfection of wisdom is profound, to that extent the Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha becomes the domain of the Thus-Gone One.

original: gang la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon
analyzed: gang la spyad pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon
translated: The Thus-Gone One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Buddha, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening through practicing it,

original: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de /
analyzed: par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de /
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, has distinguished all characteristics.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / khams kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang / tshor ba'i mtshan nyid dang ; 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de bzhin du phung po'i mtshan nyid dang / khams kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristics of form, the characteristics of feeling, the characteristics of perception, the characteristics of mental formations, the characteristics of consciousness, and likewise the characteristics of the aggregates, the characteristics of the elements,

original: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye bar mdzad pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba shes pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the classification of the characteristics of the sense-fields, of the characteristics of dependent origination, up to the knowledge of the classification of the characteristics of the knowledge of all modes is the knowledge of classification.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Lord said to the sons of gods in the world of sense desire and in the world of form:

original: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba ste /
translated: â€œO sons of gods, the characteristic of form is that it is capable of being struck.

original: @224b de de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: @224b de de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathagata has fully known that as without a basic reality.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of feeling is experience.

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of perception is the seizing of signs.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the formations is the act of forming.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni so so'i rang bzhin shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni so so'i rang bzhin shes pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of consciousness is the awareness of each individual thing.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully and perfectly realized it to be without a characteristic.

original: phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni spungs pa'o //ğŸ”½khams rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rigs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni spungs pa'o // khams rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni rigs so //
translated: The characteristic of the aggregates is a heap.ğŸ”½The characteristic of the constituents is a class.

original: skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni skye ba'i sgo'o //
analyzed: skye mched rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni skye ba'i sgo'o //
translated: The characteristic of the sense fields is a gateway.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshogs pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of dependent origination is a collection.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully and perfectly realized them to be without a characteristic.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su gtong pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni yongs su gtong pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of the perfection of generosity is complete giving.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully and perfectly realized it to be without a characteristic.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gdung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gdung ba med pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the perfection of moral discipline is freedom from distress.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'khrug pa med pa'o //
translated: The defining characteristic of the perfection of patience is non-agitation.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni brdzi ba med pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni brdzi ba med pa'o //
translated: The defining characteristic of the perfection of effort is non-submergence.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni rjes su 'dzin pa'o //

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni chags pa med pa ste /
translated: The defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom is non-attachment.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully awakened to the defining characteristic of these [perfections] as being without defining characteristics.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mi 'khrug pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mi 'khrug pa ste /
translated: The defining characteristic of the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions is non-agitation.

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully awakened to the defining characteristic of these [absorptions] as being without defining characteristics.

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi mtshan nyid ni nges par 'byin pa ste /

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of those.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dben pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni dben pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is voidness.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhi ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of signlessness is peace.

original: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'bad rtsol med pa ste /
analyzed: smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'bad rtsol med pa ste /

original: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The TathÄgata has fully awakened to the non-characteristics of those.

original: skyon thams cad snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad snyoms pa'o //

analyzed: de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
